alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 3:45AM CST until January 04 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama and southwest Alabama, including the following counties, in south central Alabama, Escambia. In southwest Alabama, Baldwin and Mobile. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen in a short amount of time. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prichard, Saraland, Bay Minette, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Creola, Chunchula, Stockton, McCullough, Gulfcrest, Axis, Mount Vernon, Semmes, Tanner Williams, Movico, I65 And AL 225, I65 And AL 158, I65 And I165, Mobile Regional Airport and Wilmer.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
